website_summaries.verdict: Modernly designed, and comes with a built-in coffee filter.
pros: According to some, this percolator will raise the bar in terms of your coffee tastes as it's able to extract flavor and richness that other coffee makers cannot
A great option for compact spaces including your office desk or camper
cons: We wish it was easier to read the measurement marks

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee once again
customer_reviews.text: Happily back to steamy, hot coffee. This is just the right size. I make 4 cups which translates to two large mugs that I drink each day. My only criticism is that the water markings on the inside are very difficult to see. Otherwise, it's a lovely percolator. I reset my coffee grinder to coarse grind and I get a great cup of coffee every time. And did I mention, it's hot! Steamy hot and fragrant.
customer_reviews.author: grandmapeg

customer_reviews.title: All looks - Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. I bought it because of some positive reviews and the fun styling but was disssapointed with the quality. Very light weight, the lid is very thin steel, felt more like “tin” and kept getting stuck in the locked position. It finally got stuck to the point i couldn’t remove it at all. The glass top cake off from trying to twist the lid loose. Metal parts have “rough” poorly finished edges. It would be better to pay a little more for something that is made better.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Zamora

customer_reviews.title: Updated review. It didn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced our Keurig with this for cleanliness reasons. This is fully washable, stainless steel and makes really good, piping hot coffee fast. No filters needed. I’ll never go back to a plastic coffee maker again. Update- Stopped working in October of 2019. This only lasted 14 months. I’m switching back to the stove top percolator. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BoyMom

customer_reviews.title: A great percolator!
customer_reviews.text: What a great percolator! I got tired of paying a fortune for Nespresso pods for everyday use and wanted to try something different from a drip coffee maker. This pot is just perfect. It makes the coffee very hot and it only takes a very short time to brew. I love everything about it!
customer_reviews.author: Shop Gal

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a 20+ yr old percolator that finally died. This perc. Is great! So easy to clean, Makes the best coffee ever with very little grounds....keeps the coffee hot, and the bottom of the percolator doe NOT get hot on the counter. This thing is fantastic!!
customer_reviews.author: Slowalkintexan

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Farberware, Hello Hamilton Beach!
customer_reviews.text: We have been Farberware Percolators for 40 + years but found the last two (yes 2) 8c pots were making weak coffee. I blamed Folgers change of mix but then researched finding the pot should perc for 8 minutes for the 8 cup pot. It actually was only going for 3 1/2 minutes. Sad after all those years they screwed up a good pot. BUT I bought this Hamilton Beach and tried it this morning. Perfect. Used the inside water measurements and used 1 Tbsp coffee per cup. Finally the Perc coffee I remember. And I didn't have any product problems.....we'll see!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Manis

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This percolator makes very good, very hot coffee within about 7 minutes. We're just using standard drip grind coffee, and it works just fine. It's easy to clean and to use. It seems well made and the plug fits snugly into the coffee pot's socket. The only quibble we have (and it's a minor one) is that it's a little tricky to read the water markings on the inside of the pot. We think ithis percolator is an exceptionally good value.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine Narayanan

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this percolator less than two months. I went to make a pot of coffee this morning and didn’t push everything inside all the way , walked away and it only made hot water. So I unplugged to start over again, it won’t work. I’ve been sitting here over one hour trying to make a cup of coffee after I’ve pushed everything back in . Do I have to wait for this unit to completely cool down to restart? If so, this is going in the trash . Not convenient for me. It looks like if I wanted to brew in succession, I couldn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Number 1 Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Works better than percolators that  are double the cost.
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be lasting longer than the Cuisinart brand percolator that I bought a couple of months ago for double the price. The percolator is much faster than either the Presto or Cuisinart brand, and the coffee is smooth and well bodied. I had purchased the Cuisinart percolator in December and after 3 weeks of use, the plug shorted and Amazon took it back. Our Presto brand lasted almost 2 years, but the coffee was not particularly rich tasting. If you like percolated coffee, this Hamilton Beach product is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jcg2313

customer_reviews.title: Great electric perculator!
customer_reviews.text: In the recent months, I have purchased at least three other stove top and electric perculators. I am trying to get the best coffee and product. I must say this Hamilton Beach coffee perculators is absolutely the best. Very well made of steel and the wiring appears to be high quality, only time will tell on the wiring. I purchased a four cup electric Farberware and the wiring is horrible. I have to move the wire around to get a good connection, and this is with the new one to replace the old one. Hamilton Beach 40621R 8 cup... buy it!
customer_reviews.author: kitzyesmickie

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great for 3 months...then I heard sizzling noises where the plug goes into the receptacle. That lasted about two weeks and then that was the end...I purchased this because I was tired of my Farberware coffee pot dying after 3-4 years....years ago these coffee pots lasted 15-20 years... Anyway I emailed company about faulty product and 2 weeks later I get a response to pay $11 and they will send me new pot after I email a pic of broken plug on old one....Amazon already reimbursed me for coffee pot...I’m done!!!!
customer_reviews.author: danna

customer_reviews.title: Great cofee maker
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars, I never give 5 unless everything perfect. This is great coffee pot. Clean, simple design. Perfect size. I make one to two cups daily. Easy set up. Easy clean. Makes it fast. Light comes on when coffee is ready. The only thing is, you cannot get it ready in advance and plug in. It has no on/off switch, as soon as u plug it in, it starts brewing. I guess u can try using a timers witch plug into wall, then plug pot into thst. It's well made grest coffee maker. I use folders coarse grounds, and coffee is clean.
customer_reviews.author: Starman

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well, But Not The Cup of Joe I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: I think this is probably a good product, and it does what it was designed to do. It was fun to relive those days of long ago of hearing the percolator perk. The coffee was clean (no grounds) and tasted good - as in ordinary coffee that you get in a Waffle House or hotel - good. But it wasn't really my cup of tea... uh, I mean coffee. I thought it would be a bit bolder tasting. I do imagine a lot of people would enjoy this though.
customer_reviews.author: Stowe Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Beats drip coffee method!  Quick brewing, great taste.
customer_reviews.text: Brews quickly. Keeps coffee hot for a long time. Love the flavor. Wish I’d bough this percolator a long time ago. Update: After using this percolator for 2 months, I can't rave enough about it. I use the percolator every morning right after I wake up and love it. It is so fast and keeps my coffee hot for hours. I drink alot of coffee and this is by far the best coffee marker I've used. Drip coffee makers take forever to brew and the coffee never tastes as good as coffee made in a percolator. I HIGHLY recommend this item!!
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Girl

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Cup Everytime!
customer_reviews.text: I was using one of the modern single cup maker.... and at least three times a week I was trying to get it to make a half cup, it would not brew a full cup. So, I am back with the old method and I swear, the coffee is wonderful! This pot brews quickly and keeps the coffee hot for hours. When this coffee maker dies, as they all eventually do, I will replace it with another Hamilton Beach.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny

customer_reviews.title: Checks all the boxes...so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've been making coffee with this for about 2 weeks. The Hamilton has met all my expectations. Excellent coffee. Very fast. Very hot. Easy to get used to. Easy to clean. I appreciate that only stainless steel touches my coffee. No plastic. No aluminum. Since it has only been 2 weeks, I will have to return after a time and comment on durability.
customer_reviews.author: don

customer_reviews.title: This pot of the past is the future of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: The future of brewing. Really. Retro modern design, flawless brewing, comforting sound. And the taste is the best. I have been using a Melitta single cup pour for the past ten years, and really loved it. And occasionally I would use my tried and true Mr. Coffee, with no complaints. This 8-cup HB perc brews a much more flavorful brew than either, and the coffee is always hot, ready fast and tastes so much better. It somehow managed to bring out a better flavor in the coffee. I really, really love it!
customer_reviews.author: E. Harris

customer_reviews.title: So superior to a drip coffee machine
customer_reviews.text: We love this coffee pot. Coffee is quick, hot, and delicious. My only complaint is that the fill lines to make a partial pot of coffee are difficult to read. They are on the inside of the pot, embossed, but not heavily enough to make out well.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle Dove

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched from the usual mostly plastic drip coffee maker to this entirely stainless steel and glass percolator and am very happy with it. Just as fast and easy as drip, but easier to clean and no paper filter necessary. Only took off a star because the cord is too short and I wish there was auto shut off. Update: its almost exactly 2 years since I bought this, used it practically everyday, and now its dead.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Marie Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Brewmaster
customer_reviews.text: This pot gives grounds for stating this the the best percolator I have ever owned The pot is well designed for beauty and practicality Makes coffee in a jiffy Even the instruction booklet is written for clarity and ease of understanding I think many people have given up on the K-cup fad as the pods are expensive and wasteful
customer_reviews.author: victorwrite

customer_reviews.title: Not Good!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this coffee pot in June, 2018. Yesterday I threw it out. About a month ago, coffee was warm, at best, when finished percolating. Had to microwave each cup of coffee. Last week, coffee was hardly warm at all. Considering it did not cost very much, I decided to just toss it rather than bothering with trying to ship it out for warranty work. Maybe I just got a bad one. Just my luck!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Too hot ...burns coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Very deep basket..not the easiest to put coffee in. Also stays too hot after perked and makes the coffee taste burned.
customer_reviews.author: Barnie

customer_reviews.title: Makes good coffee but poorly designed.
customer_reviews.text: Makes good coffee but the lid is very poorly designed and has subsequently broke completely. the glass top twists on/off along with the metal lid. if you don't have the glass top tight enough or if the metal top is too tight you will twist off the glass top and then it is incredibly difficult to get the metal top off. If you over-tighten the glass top it will break the tabs that hold it tight, this is what happened to me. Now i can't tighten the lid properly and coffee leaks everywhere, time to buy a new one and I won't be purchasing this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: Working good, one problem.
customer_reviews.text: I finally got fed up with the dang drip coffee makers - even expensive ones - dying and whimping out in a year or two (clogging up, getting cooler, making whimpy tasting coffee), so I switched to this good old fashioned percolator! I do love the little glass window on top. It makes a nice full flavored cup of coffee. The problem with this model is, THERE IS NO SHUT OFF SWITCH or timed shut off. So, you have to remember to un-plug it, and if you forget, as far as I can tell, it will remain turned on for ever.. or until it burns out, or burns your house down. Not a good design element.
customer_reviews.author: EarOne

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 8 months 😡😡
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item in July and today it stopped working completely broken, light won’t come on and there is no-one to contact. I expected it to last longer than 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: I am loving my percolator!
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of semi hot, semi fresh, semi good , expensive coffee with Kerurig machines. I remember the great coffee my parents and grand parents always had using a percolator and am I glad I did. It takes about a minute to clean and reload for a fresh pot. Brewing time is about 4 minutes for 4-5 cups. I like to grind my own coffee beans so coffee is fresh and HOT after brewing. I use a timer so coffee ready before I get up and fills the house with great coffee smells. You can also use the grounds in your garden. Never going back to single serve again.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Lady

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTE JUNK!  NO SERVICE Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: Really think three times before deluding yourself into believing you’re the exception and that you’ll be the one in a million to beat the odds and receive a one off quality product. Spend your money on the lottery where the odds are you’ll fair better. The lid/twist to lock glass button is a flawed design that will prevent you from using the product long enough to experience imminent electrical failures. If you enjoy seeing volcano like spurts of scalding hot percolating coffee erupting and spewing coffee all over your countertops then treat yourself to this dangerous product.
customer_reviews.author: Bigdog

customer_reviews.title: Coffee pot works fine but top broke on second day
customer_reviews.text: Coffee pot works fine but top broke on second day, another customer had same problem. I tried to reach Hamilton Beach with no success. Now have to send whole thing back and get a new one, thank goodness for Amazon customer service. They fix everything that nobody else does.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pot in March 2019, it is now June and the percolator is barley working. It did great for the first month, then started its decline. The past few weeks it’s been taking long to brew, making all kinds of loud,obnoxious noises while brewing, then the coffee is lukewarm when it’s finally finished brewing. I’m waiting 20 minutes currently for my morning coffee and it’s still not ready. Once it is, I’ll have to heat it up in the microwave. $60 is a lot of money for a coffee pot that lasted 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: RainyA

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I had been wondering why coffee wasn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I had been wondering why coffee wasn't smelling good to me like it did years ago, so I thought I'd try a percolator. Not only does it smell better, it tastes better! Comes out very hot too.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Van Doren

customer_reviews.title: Trouble on the horizone
customer_reviews.text: Really cranks out the coffee-fast. Downsize is the glass top came loose less than two weeks after purchasing. Therefore making it nearly impossible to remove the lid. This one needs to go back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey boy

customer_reviews.title: Cover jammed 3rd time. Wierd seal thing is loose. Too complex.
customer_reviews.text: Removing cover was difficult at first. Then the third time my mother used it the cover jammed and would not come off. I got a tool and pried it off. There was a seal thing disk loose inside. Kind of a complex fussy cover design that failed basic using situation. Mom's had percolators all her life, she's 80, and this one she found to be a serious problem.
customer_reviews.author: RickWAllen

customer_reviews.title: Hot Cup of Coffee
customer_reviews.text: This percolator-coffee maker has the advantage of producing a hot cup of coffee, unlike the coffee makers that we have had; used to have to heat our barely-hot coffee further in a microwave. Have enjoyed skipping that step with the Hamilton Beach for about four months. It is easy to clean and takes little space.
customer_reviews.author: Ok

customer_reviews.title: This broke after the first use, the top sticks you then the plastic part breaks
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible coffee maker. We went through two before going to another brand. On both, the top sticks and the plastic part breaks off when you try to get it off.
customer_reviews.author: Parisa

customer_reviews.title: Probably should be recalled: Fire Hazard
customer_reviews.text: Maybe should be recalled? We've had ours for three years and LOVED it. Last week, I noticed it wouldn't start perking right away like usual. Today, it shot flames out of the cord and burnt our countertop. If it weren't for other people complaining about the cord getting unusually hot and sparking, I would've thought it's just old but I've read a lot of other people's reviews mentioning it. Just thought you all should know. Photo one: burnt counter Photo two: burn in the cord from where it caught fire
customer_reviews.author: B. Vogt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The coffee it makes is much better than drip. We have all been duped on the drip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pot
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for. 8 cups and a good, sleek size. The sounds and fragrances that come from my new pot make me so happy in the morning. This pot is sturdy and ergonomic. Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: JoAnna Travaglini

customer_reviews.title: Amazing coffee. I don't understand why everyone stopped using ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing coffee. I don't understand why everyone stopped using percolators, better than the Keurig and the automatic drip. It's so much smoother and I use less sugar. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Forsten Ohana

customer_reviews.title: A lot of extra work with little or no difference in coffee taste.
customer_reviews.text: We returned the percolator after just two days. Compared to our drip coffee maker, there was little or no difference in the taste of coffee. But it takes considerably more time to make the coffee in the morning. And cleanup is more work. To us, it just was not worth all the extra activity. On a positive note, the Amazon return process is excellent. Very impressed with how that worked.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Baker

customer_reviews.title: Makes terrible tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year and use it periodically at work or when I have a lot of people over at home and need to have extra coffee on hand. Out of all of the coffee appliances I have ever owned and used (drip machines, stove-top glass percolators, and french presses), this makes the worst tasting coffee I have ever had. I have used it about a dozen times in the last year, thinking that it might get better. It doesn't. And it's not the coffee, because when I use the same coffee in my stove top percolator, the coffee tastes amazing. On the bright side, it brews the coffee quickly and keeps it very hot.
customer_reviews.author: Carli

customer_reviews.title: Burnt out after 6 months, and warranty is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Heating unit burnt out after six months. Tried using different cords and no luck. Warranty was for a year. But Hamilton Beach does not replace the unit, they gave me a credit, that was $10 below my purchase price towards any item that was in a special link. And the consumer has to pay shipping. There were no peculators that fell within the price range, and to spend shipping money on something I did not need seemed like a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Joan F.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The coffee is much better than the drip machines. I love the brand easy to use and clean!
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: This brews coffee quickly , great little pot, I fill three coffee mugs for me, like this  product
customer_reviews.text: Makes coffee quickly, what I say, I like it, would buy again
customer_reviews.author: dianne

customer_reviews.title: Try finding parts
customer_reviews.text: Love the coffee maker but, the spring kept falling off of the stem and eventually was lost. Hamilton beach is the only place to find a replacement stem. The stem is $2.99 plus $17.85 for shipping! Are you kidding me!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Loving My Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I have used all types of coffee makers and a french press. The coffee tastes so delicious that I plan to use the percolator from now on. I think it is so good because it is designed to be cleaned with each use. I prepare a pot the night before and I just plug it in in the morning. It brews in approximately 5 to 6 minutes. The ratio is 1 tablespoonful of coffee to 1 cup of water. I add 1 more tablespoon of coffee since I like a stronger bolder taste. Medium strength coffee works the best but I suppose that is determined by preference. It looks pretty in my kitchen too!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: Excellent coffee maker, easy to use and make great tasting coffee than regular coffee maker. Easy to clean, I just rinse in warm water. Blue light is on the bottom of the front of the coffee maker, I was looking for it on the top. Anyway, it is the right size, doesn't take that much room like a coffee maker and won't break.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice percolator
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this to brew his coffee everyday, and it's a solid and dependable unit. Really liked that the lid had a glass bubble on top instead of plastic, the whole unit is easy to clean (we use a little bleach in the soap water every other time). Keeps his coffee warm without burning after the perk is done.
customer_reviews.author: Anna D.

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far.
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this daily and likes the taste of the coffee from it. It is a bit of a pain to handwash and dry, but it is more sanitary than the automatic coffee makers since you can never really get the inside very clean or dried out so it is always moist in there. This one doesn't have that problem. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: cec

customer_reviews.title: Efficient & Reliable
customer_reviews.text: We like the taste of percolated coffee but didn’t want the hassle of a stovetop percolator. Also needed a fairly compact unit to fit the space available. There was one other brand we considered but it cost more. Very glad we chose this, it’s trouble free, quick, just short enough to tuck in under the top cabinet, and holds exactly 4 big mugs-ful, just right for 2 of us to start our day. It’s also so retro that some millennials have never seen one, so you might call it educational too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great retro-style and look!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift that was greatly appreciated! Love the retro-style and look, as well as the size. As advertised and shipped quickly. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: pcoesmith

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee, but cord already gone bad.
customer_reviews.text: Had this percolator for about 6 months and I love it. It makes great coffee, however, the cord has already gone bad. Had to order a new one from company. Not a big deal, just annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Mamasan9

customer_reviews.title: Bad Design
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to buy this percolator but it’s a horrible design. It’s way too top heavy and the handle broke off early on. The electric cord it came with doesn’t work anymore and now it only turns on if I hold the cord in a certain position while trying to make coffee. Not only that, but it doesn’t just stay warm while it’s plugged in. After about ten minutes it rebrews the same pot and coffee grinds. Either the whole model is awful or I got a defective percolator.
customer_reviews.author: victoria vinci

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: At first we really loved this pot but after less than a year it quit percolating like it should. No matter how much coffee we use now it taste weak.
customer_reviews.author: K. Banuat

customer_reviews.title: I have had it less than 2 months and stopped working!!
customer_reviews.text: a couple weeks ago it shocked me a 2-3 different times while inserting the plug into the coffee pot. This gave me pause. Now in the past couple days it shuts itself off and doesn't keep the coffee warm let alone HOT! It will then perk randomly when nothing else has been added to the percolator. VERY DISAPPOINTED. NO MORE HAMILTION BEACH PRODUCTS
customer_reviews.author: JAXON

customer_reviews.title: so good. Coffee tastes great and is plenty hot
customer_reviews.text: I decided to go back in time with this pot. It had reached a point where I was having to buy a new drip pot every year. Not even the high dollar pots hold up any more. So far, so good. Coffee tastes great and is plenty hot. I think this is a good choice if you're tired of buying new ones every year! I put it on a separate timer. No on/off switch to this pot.
customer_reviews.author: TX-East Side

customer_reviews.title: Love Perk coffee
customer_reviews.text: Been using the pods for years but decided I deserved a good cup of perked coffee. This pot is beautiful and makes great coffee. I love the glass knob because half the fun in a percolator is watching it perk! It pours without a drip.
customer_reviews.author: BENGAL

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker!
customer_reviews.text: I love this percolator! I've gone through all manner of making coffee and this is my favorite. It beats them all-Keurig, drip, French press, pour over, Aeropress, etc. It is quick and easy to clean out and set up. I like that it keeps the coffee hot, but not burnt. It is easy to store, if that's important to you.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Makes excellent coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten so many compliments on my coffee pot! I love it! It makes better coffee than the drip makers & it has a wonderful retro feel to it which I love! The pouring handle is very sturdy & it's very easy to clean! This was a great investment! 😊💕👍
customer_reviews.author: Noreen Scully

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Percolating
customer_reviews.text: This works just as I wanted it to work! Coffee is delicious, a bit stronger than a drip coffee maker but with a richer flavor. Easy to use, makes a lovely perking sound, and fun to watch coffee perk in the clear top.
customer_reviews.author: wildjoy

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach does false advertising!  I’ve been duped.  Change ur advertising!
customer_reviews.text: Want stainless percolator. Like u said yours was. Allergy to aluminum. Trusted. All are 100% ALUMINUM!!️!!️!!️!!️!!️!!️ You are lying to all your customers! I’m disabled. How do I get $ back.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Bales

customer_reviews.title: Percolator is the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: This makes great coffee & I have made it many ways, drip, French Press, coffee maker, etc...and I love the way the coffee comes out with this percolator! It may be old-school but, it sure makes a great cuppa!
customer_reviews.author: Skye

customer_reviews.title: percolator
customer_reviews.text: I like this way of making coffee. Easy, tastes good, stops perking when finished, stays warm. Fun to see the coffee pop up into the coffee lid. All good.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary1001

customer_reviews.title: I have been through numerous coffee pots searching for the perfect one for the perfect flavor
customer_reviews.text: For the past 2 years, I have been through numerous coffee pots searching for the perfect one for the perfect flavor. I found it with this percolator. I love everything about this percolator. Easy to clean, and great tasting coffee. Coffee does not tasted burned while staying warm. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MoKa

customer_reviews.title: Delivered April 18, dead September 18.
customer_reviews.text: That’s 5 months, folks. The cord into the percolator failed, complete with sparks. It took 2 weeks to finally die completely. I nursed it along for a week, but knew death was imminent. A visit to my basement turned up an electric percolator I used in the mid 1960s, (General Electric) which I will use henceforth. It has 3 strength settings, with variables between, and a warming setting. I guess “they don’t make-em like they used to”, rings true. Plus, it’s way cuter on my counter. Very graceful lines.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Carter Moore

customer_reviews.title: The best tasting coffee ever!
customer_reviews.text: They don't make things like they used to so going back to a percolator was kinda funny but...hey...it makes the perfect...strong cup of coffee every time and takes no time at all to make!!!!
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this so much. So easy to use, no need for filters.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great 8 cup coffee pot. It works well but the outside does get very hot--it has an extra solid handle so it is not a problem to pour and move but might be a problem if little children are around as it is so shiny.
customer_reviews.author: ALAN

customer_reviews.title: the top glass knob is very hard to take off ...

product_meta.description: Hamilton Beach Coffee Percolators brew the flavorful coffee that you've come to expect from our name, in less than a minute per cup. The ready-to-serve light that tells you when your coffee's ready and an automatic keep warm function to hold your coffee at the right temperature. Hamilton Beach Percolators have easy-to-read measurement markings and a detachable cord for ease and convenience. They also come with a permanent stainless steel filter basket that goes right in the dishwasher for easy cleanup. Enjoy flavorful percolated coffee with the help of Hamilton Beach, the name that knows great coffee.
